results_summary: Ursolic acid bound effectively to MD-2, reduced cytokine levels (IL-1β, IL-6, TNF-α, NO), and downregulated inflammatory pathway proteins (MD-2, MyD88, p-NF-κB p65, iNOS) in a dose-dependent manner, demonstrating anti-sepsis effects.
population_specificity: Raw 264.7 cells (murine macrophage cell line) cultured in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ursolic acid (UA) could inhibit Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb)-induced pyroptosis and necroptosis in macrophages, enhance autophagy, and improve intracellular killing of Mtb.
results_summary: UA inhibited Mtb-induced pyroptosis and necroptosis in macrophages, induced autophagy, and enhanced intracellular killing of Mtb by synergistically inhibiting the Akt/mTOR and TNF-α/TNFR1 signaling pathways. These effects suggest UA could be a potential adjuvant for host-targeted anti-TB therapy by modulating immune responses and reducing excessive inflammation.
population_specificity: Macrophages (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential targets and mechanism of ursolic acid (UA) on gastric cancer (GC) and COVID-19 using network pharmacology and bioinformatics analysis.
results_summary: The study identified 32 intersection targets of UA and GC/COVID-19, primarily enriched in FoxO, PI3K/Akt, and ErbB signaling pathways. UA showed strong binding to core targets like PARP1 and MAPK14, suggesting potential therapeutic effects via anti-inflammatory, anti-oxidation, anti-virus, and immune regulation mechanisms.
population_specificity: Patients with gastric cancer and COVID-19.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role and mechanisms of Ursolic Acid (UA) in treating cancer cachexia, specifically its effects on muscle wasting and inflammatory markers.
results_summary: UA attenuated muscle atrophy in C2C12 myotubes and LLC tumor-bearing mice, activated SIRT1, downregulated MuRF1 and Atrogin-1, and suppressed inflammatory cytokines without affecting tumor growth. These effects were reversed by SIRT1 inhibition.
population_specificity: Lewis lung carcinoma (LLC) tumor-bearing mice and C2C12 myotubes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer efficacy of ursolic acid-loaded chitosan nanoparticles (UACNP) in DMBA-induced oral carcinoma.
results_summary: UACNP reversed DMBA-induced abnormalities in oxidative markers and detoxification cascade, demonstrating tumor-inhibiting effects in experimental oral carcinogenesis.
population_specificity: DMBA-induced oral carcinoma in an experimental model (not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ursolic acid (UA) acts as a natural antagonist of RORγ in cancer cells and its potential therapeutic effects in prostate and triple-negative breast cancer.
results_summary: UA strongly inhibited RORγ-dependent transactivation in cancer cells, downregulated AR signaling in prostate cancer, and altered RORγ-controlled gene programs in TNBC, while digoxin showed no such effects. The study identified RORγ as a direct target of UA in cancer cells, suggesting its potential for patient-specific treatment.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer (castration-resistant) and triple-negative breast cancer cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize existing studies on the effects of ursolic acid and its derivatives against prostate and other urogenital cancers.
results_summary: Ursolic acid demonstrated inhibition of human prostate, renal, bladder, and testicular cancer cell proliferation and induced apoptosis. Limited animal studies showed significant tumor volume reduction in xenografted human prostate cancer cells treated with ursolic acid.
population_specificity: Human prostate, renal, bladder, and testicular cancer cells; animal models xenografted with human prostate cancer cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop self-assembled nanoparticles of ursolic acid (UA NPs) to improve its ability to cross the blood-brain barrier and treat glioblastoma multiforme (GBM).
results_summary: UA NPs effectively crossed the blood-brain barrier, induced autophagy and apoptosis in glioblastoma cells, and significantly improved survival time in intracranial xenograft models.
population_specificity: Intracranial xenograft mouse models (not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if ursolic acid (UA) could reverse cisplatin resistance in lung cancer cells by inhibiting the Jak2/Stat3 pathway and reducing cancer stem cell enrichment.
results_summary: UA inhibited the Jak2/Stat3 pathway, reduced levels of pluripotent stem cell transcription factors (Oct-4, Sox-2, c-Myc), and reversed cisplatin resistance in A549-CisR lung cancer cells. This suggests UA may be effective in overcoming chemotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
population_specificity: Human lung cancer cell line A549 and its cisplatin-resistant variant (A549-CisR).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the hepatoprotective effects of Ursolic Acid (UA) when delivered via UA/Tween 80 nanovesicles (V-UA) and compare its efficacy and targeting ability to liposomal UA (Lipo-UA).
results_summary: The study found that V-UA demonstrated superior hepatocyte targeting and higher drug loading capacity compared to Lipo-UA, leading to improved efficacy in treating liver diseases across three disease models. The nanovesicle formulation also stabilized UA and enhanced its cellular uptake in hepatocytes.
population_specificity: Liver disease models (specific human or animal population not specified).
effective_dosage: Molar ratio of UA to Tween 80 up to 2:1 (specific dosage not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ursolic acid (UA) promotes the transition of LPS/IFNγ-activated BV2 microglia from M1 to M2 polarization and if this effect is mediated through PPARγ activation.
results_summary: UA shifted LPS/IFNγ-activated BV2 microglia from the M1 to M2 phenotype, reduced neurotoxic factors MMP2 and MMP9, and increased anti-inflammatory factor TIMP1. These effects were PPARγ-dependent, as co-treatment with a PPARγ inhibitor reversed them.
population_specificity: BV2 microglia (in vitro) and rats (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of Ursolic Acid (UA) on hypertrophic scar formation and its mechanism, focusing on fibroblast behavior and the Smad2/3 pathway.
results_summary: UA significantly reduced TGF-β-induced fibroblast proliferation, migration, contractility, and collagen deposition by inhibiting Smad2/3 phosphorylation, likely through binding to the ALK5 protein domain.
population_specificity: Fibroblasts isolated from normal skin (NSFBs) and hypertrophic scars (HSFBs), treated with TGF-β.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effect of Ursolic Acid (UA) in atopic dermatitis (AD) mice and explore its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: UA significantly reduced dermatitis scores and ear thickness, inhibited skin proliferation and mast cell infiltration, decreased T helper cytokine levels, improved oxidative stress, and modulated the TLR4/NF-κB and Nrf2/HO-1 pathways in AD mice and stimulated HaCaT cells.
population_specificity: Balb/c mice with DNCB-induced AD-like lesions and TNF-α/IFN-γ-stimulated HaCaT cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel nanomedicine combining Ursolic Acid (UA) and astragaloside IV (AS-IV) for treating non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) metastasis through chemotherapy, photothermal therapy, and immunotherapy.
results_summary: The nanomedicine significantly improved the aqueous solubility and tumor-targeting ability of UA and AS-IV, enhancing UA-mediated cytotoxicity and anti-metastatic effects against NSCLC cells while boosting AS-IV-mediated immune responses. The combined approach effectively inhibited primary tumor growth and distant metastasis in vitro and in vivo.
population_specificity: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cells and models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial and anticancer potential of ursolic acid-based hybrid compounds through synthesis, molecular docking, and in vitro studies.
results_summary: Several synthesized compounds demonstrated significant antibacterial activity (MIC values of 15.625 μg/ml) and cytotoxicity against human cancer cells, with compounds 29 and 34 showing better efficacy than ursolic acid. Molecular docking studies indicated favorable binding interactions with EGFR, suggesting potential for anticancer and antimicrobial applications.
population_specificity: In vitro studies on bacterial strains and human cancer cell lines (MDA-MB-231, HeLa, and MCF-7).
effective_dosage: MIC values of 15.625 μg/ml for antibacterial activity; IC50 values of 46.99 and 48.18 μg/ml for cytotoxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic effect and potential mechanisms of Ursolic Acid (UA) in protecting against liver injury and hepatic steatosis in an alcoholic liver disease (ALD) mouse model.
results_summary: UA significantly reduced alcohol-induced liver injury and hepatic steatosis, ameliorated metabolic disorders, oxidative stress, and inflammation, and activated autophagy via the AMPK-ACC pathway to protect hepatocytes from lipotoxicity.
population_specificity: ALD mouse model and AML12/HepG2 cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective potential of ursolic acid (UA) in reversing Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology and improving cognitive deficits in an Aβ1-42-induced AD mouse model.
results_summary: UA significantly reduced Aβ plaques, restored neuronal density (evidenced by DCX and Ki-67 immunoreactivity), and improved social affiliation in Aβ1-42-treated mice, with effects comparable to donepezil. Molecular docking studies supported UA's binding affinity to neurogenesis markers.
population_specificity: Male BALB/c mice with Aβ1-42-induced AD-like pathology.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Ursolic Acid supplementation on cardiometabolic risk factors in humans.
results_summary: The study found that Ursolic Acid supplementation (50.94 to 450 mg/day) did not significantly alter body weight, BMI, waist circumference, body fat percentage, lean body mass, blood pressure, fasting glucose, insulin, triglycerides, or HDL compared to control groups.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer properties of Ursolic Acid (UA), including its mechanisms of action and potential to inhibit cancer cell production and proliferation.
results_summary: The study found that Ursolic Acid (UA) exhibits anti-inflammatory, anticancer, and anti-carcinogenic properties, inhibits cancer cell viability and proliferation, and prevents tumor angiogenesis and metastatic activity.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on cancer cell lines and animal models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Ursolic Acid supplementation combined with exercise on metabolic syndrome components in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: Ursolic Acid supplementation showed greater improvement in handgrip strength compared to placebo but did not significantly affect waist circumference or other metabolic syndrome components. Both groups had similar remission rates for metabolic syndrome.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women (61 ± 7 years)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of ursolic acid as an adjunctive treatment for obesity-mediated metabolic abnormalities, focusing on adiposity, energy expenditure, and skeletal muscle mass.
results_summary: The study found that ursolic acid enhances thermogenesis, increases skeletal muscle mass, and improves physical fitness through various physiological and molecular mechanisms, suggesting its potential as a therapy for obesity-related metabolic issues.
population_specificity: Mice and humans (based on 17 eligible studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antimicrobial activity of Arctostaphylos uva-ursi leaf extract against Cutibacterium acnes and its potential as a therapeutic option for acne vulgaris.
results_summary: The study found that Uva ursi extract exhibited significant antimicrobial activity against planktonic C. acnes (MIC90 of 0.6 mg/mL) and disrupted biofilm formation. It also inhibited pro-inflammatory cytokine secretion without affecting human keratinocyte viability.
population_specificity: In vitro study using planktonic C. acnes and immortalized human keratinocytes (HaCaT cells).
effective_dosage: 0.3 mg/mL and 0.6 mg/mL (sub-MIC and MIC concentrations).
study_duration: 24 and 48 hours for cell viability and cytokine assays.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the chemical composition and effects of a dry alcohol extract from bearberry leaves, enriched with cysteine, on pancreatic function in rats with dexamethasone-induced insulin resistance.
results_summary: The study found that the bearberry leaves extract, especially when enriched with cysteine, had hypoglycemic and pancreatic protective effects, improving hyperglycemia, insulin resistance, and beta cell reduction in the treated animals.
population_specificity: Rats with dexamethasone-induced insulin resistance.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how intrinsic biological, climatic, and geographic factors affect phenolic compound variation in wild bearberry populations across the Iberian Peninsula.
results_summary: The study found significant variation in phenolic compounds, including arbutin, catechin, and myricetin, influenced by geographic and climatic factors. Elite genotypes with higher antioxidant capacity were identified.
population_specificity: 42 wild populations of bearberry (Arctostaphylos uva-ursi) across a latitude and altitude gradient in the Iberian Peninsula.
study_duration: Leaves were collected over a three-year period (2014-2016).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if initial treatment with uva ursi (UU) reduces antibiotic use in women with uncomplicated UTIs without increasing symptom burden or complications compared to antibiotic treatment.
results_summary: Uva ursi reduced antibiotic use by 63.6% but resulted in a higher symptom burden (136.5% compared to control) and more cases of pyelonephritis (8 vs. 2 in the fosfomycin group). Adverse events were similar between groups.
population_specificity: Adult women with suspected uncomplicated UTIs in Germany.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Uva ursi, alongside a delayed antibiotic prescription, could relieve UTI symptoms and reduce antibiotic consumption in women with acute uncomplicated UTIs.
results_summary: The study found no evidence that Uva ursi reduced symptom severity or antibiotic consumption compared to placebo. However, ibuprofen advice significantly reduced antibiotic use without increasing complications.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-70 years with symptoms of dysuria, urgency, or frequency of urination and suspected lower UTI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanism of ursolic acid in treating osteoporosis and identify its potential therapeutic targets and signaling pathways.
results_summary: The study identified 43 common target genes between ursolic acid and osteoporosis, with 24 core genes (e.g., TP53, IL6, VEGFA) implicated in pathways like apoptosis and inflammation. Molecular docking showed strong binding activity (binding energies < -5 kcal/mol), suggesting ursolic acid may treat osteoporosis by regulating these genes.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico and database analysis)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether initial treatment with Uva ursi (Arctostaphylos uva-ursi) could reduce antibiotic use in women with uncomplicated UTIs without significantly increasing symptom burden or complications.
results_summary: The study compared Uva ursi to fosfomycin, with the primary outcomes being antibiotic use reduction and symptom burden. The trial would be considered positive if Uva ursi showed superiority in reducing antibiotic courses and non-inferiority in symptom burden compared to fosfomycin.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-75 with suspected UTIs and at least two symptoms (dysuria, urgency, frequency, or lower abdominal pain).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ursolic Acid (UA) could prevent cardiac dysfunction induced by ischemia/reperfusion (I/R) injury and explore its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: UA administration significantly reduced I/R-induced cardiac dysfunction, infarct size, apoptosis, and oxidative stress in mice by activating immunoproteasome-mediated PP2A degradation and AMPK-PGC1α signaling, improving mitochondrial function. In vitro, UA also prevented hypoxia/reperfusion-induced cardiomyocyte apoptosis and mitochondrial dysfunction.
population_specificity: Male wild-type mice and in vitro cardiomyocytes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Uva ursi, alone or with ibuprofen, provides symptom relief and reduces antibiotic use in adult women with suspected UTIs.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results for Uva ursi, but the study design suggests it will evaluate symptom severity and antibiotic use as primary and secondary outcomes.
population_specificity: Adult women with suspected urinary tract infection presenting to primary care.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a low dose of Arctostaphylos uva-ursi on rabbits, focusing on hematological, biochemical, and histopathological changes.
results_summary: The study found gender-based variations in hematological and biochemical parameters but no significant pathology in heart, stomach, liver, or kidney tissues at a dose of 25 mg/kg/day. Urine analysis results were comparable to standard and control treatments.
population_specificity: Rabbits

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Uva ursi's active principles, including their biogenesis, isolation, qualitative and quantitative differences during the vegetative period, and changes during technological treatment and pharmacological activity.
results_summary: The study highlights Uva ursi's phenolic glucosides as key active principles responsible for its disinfective effect on the urinary tract, supporting its pharmaceutical use in medicinal teas. The research also examines variations in active principles during different growth stages and processing.
population_specificity: Not specified (general pharmaceutical application)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of valerian for sleep disturbances, particularly insomnia, through an umbrella review of systematic reviews.
results_summary: The study found that valerian has a good safety profile but no evidence of efficacy for treating insomnia. Subjective sleep quality improvements were reported, but these were not supported by quantitative or objective measurements.
population_specificity: Young adults with sleep-onset difficulties.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether valerian hydroalcoholic extract, alone or combined with exercise, could improve endothelial dysfunction and antioxidant levels in diabetic rats.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of valerian extract and exercise improved vascular vasodilator response and increased levels of antioxidants (GPx and SOD) in diabetic rats. Valerian extract alone showed beneficial effects, but the synergistic effect with exercise was more pronounced.
population_specificity: Diabetic Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the anti-insomnia effects of valerian volatile oil (VVO) and investigate its potential mechanism of action through chemical analysis, network pharmacology, and experimental validation.
results_summary: The study found that VVO significantly reduced autonomous activity, decreased sleep latency, and extended sleep duration in mice, with molecular interactions suggesting effects on targets like MAOB. Western blot experiments confirmed decreased MAOB expression in the cerebral cortex.
population_specificity: Mice (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of valerian and gabapentin on restless legs syndrome (RLS) and sleep quality in hemodialysis (HD) patients.
results_summary: Valerian was less effective than gabapentin in improving RLS but equally effective in improving sleep quality, with no statistically significant difference between the two groups for sleep outcomes.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis (HD) patients with restless legs syndrome.
study_duration: 1 month per phase (with a 1-month washout period).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the active components and mechanisms of action of valerian volatile oil in treating insomnia using a PCPA-induced rat model.
results_summary: Valerian essential oil prolonged sleep duration and alleviated insomnia-induced tension and anxiety in rats, likely by upregulating 5-HT1AR and activating the serotonergic synapse pathway to increase 5-HT and GABA expression.
population_specificity: SD rats with PCPA-induced insomnia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antinociceptive (pain-relieving) effects of a valerian-hops combination in mice to justify its potential use as a safe and effective analgesic.
results_summary: The valerian-hops combination at 100 and 200 mg/kg significantly reduced pain responses in multiple tests (acetic acid-induced writhing, formalin and glutamate-induced paw licking, and tail immersion), with effects partially mediated by the opioid system.
population_specificity: Swiss albino mice
interactions: Naloxone (opioid receptor antagonist) opposed the antinociceptive effect in the tail immersion test.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the pharmacological activity of Valerian extract capsule (VEC) in treating gastrointestinal diseases, focusing on its gastroprotective and spasmolytic effects.
results_summary: VEC reduced gastric lesions and mucosal damage, enhanced antioxidant and cytoprotective markers, and alleviated inflammatory mediators. It also decreased smooth muscle contraction and promoted intestinal transit in mice.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats and C57BL/6 mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Valerian extract on sleep spindles and anxiety in a rat model of chronic neuropathic pain.
results_summary: Valerian treatment repaired neuropathy-induced allodynia, decreased REM sleep, increased non-REM sleep, and improved sleep spindle density and frequency in neuropathic conditions.
population_specificity: Male rats with chronic constriction injury (CCI) or sham surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the role of valerian in treating postoperative sleep disturbances and compare its usage to other sleep medications.
results_summary: Valerian was the second most used sleep medication (26.4%) after benzodiazepines (36.9%), primarily as monotherapy. It was more common in women, elderly patients, and those with prolonged hospital stays, suggesting its clinical relevance for these groups.
population_specificity: 21,168 urological, gynecological, and general surgical patients at a German university medical center (2015–2020).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cytotoxicity and oxidative stress effects of valerian root extract in human liver hepatocellular carcinoma (HepG2) and human colorectal adenocarcinoma (Caco2) cell lines.
results_summary: Valerian root extract showed cytotoxicity with IC50 values of 936.6 µg/mL in HepG2 and 1097.5 µg/mL in Caco2 cell lines but did not induce oxidative stress. The study concluded that valerian may not be effective for cancer treatment and could pose public health risks, though it may be safe at tolerated concentrations.
population_specificity: Human liver hepatocellular carcinoma (HepG2) and human colorectal adenocarcinoma (Caco2) cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of valerian treatment on maternal care, toxicity, milk composition in postpartum rats, and its impact on offspring development, memory, and anxiety behavior.
results_summary: Valerian did not alter maternal toxicity or care behavior but increased lactose and reduced protein in milk at higher doses. Offspring development was unaffected, but long-term memory impairment was observed in female offspring at 1000 mg·kg-1·day-1.
population_specificity: Postpartum Wistar rats and their offspring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of valerian and lemon balm as an adjunct to quetiapine in reducing agitation and delirium in critically ill ICU patients.
results_summary: The study found that adding Neurogol (valerian and lemon balm) to quetiapine significantly reduced agitation and shortened ICU stay, with no adverse effects reported. However, there was no significant difference in delirium improvement between the treatment and placebo groups.
population_specificity: Critically ill adult ICU patients with delirium and agitation.
effective_dosage: 5 mL of Neurogol syrup (valerian and lemon balm combination) every 12 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of valerian on sleep quality, depression, and state anxiety in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Valerian significantly improved sleep quality, reduced depression, and alleviated state anxiety in hemodialysis patients, with greater effects observed in the valerian group compared to placebo. The crossover phase confirmed these benefits, though the magnitude of improvement varied between groups.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients
effective_dosage: Not specified (administered one hour before sleep nightly)
study_duration: One month per phase (with a one-month washout period)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if valerian, particularly its active ingredient valeric acid, could inhibit breast cancer cell growth and induce epigenetic changes related to histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibition and DNA methylation.
results_summary: Aqueous valerian extract and valeric acid reduced breast cancer cell proliferation, migration, colony formation, and 3D formation in vitro, along with decreased HDAC activity and global DNA hypomethylation, suggesting potential anti-tumorigenic effects via epigenetic modifications.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of valerian root extract on sleep quality in patients after coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery.
results_summary: Valerian root extract significantly improved sleep quality in various dimensions (total sleep quality, sleep latency, sleep duration, sleep efficiency, and daytime dysfunction) compared to placebo, with no significant adverse effects on prothrombin time or partial thromboplastin time.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent CABG surgery.
effective_dosage: 530 mg of valerian capsules per night.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how methionine and phosphate concentrations affect cadmium (Cd) uptake and translocation in Valeriana officinalis L.
results_summary: Methionine reduced Cd accumulation in roots by up to 40% but increased Cd uptake in shoots by 50%. Phosphate levels influenced Cd retention in roots, with higher levels increasing Cd accumulation in the presence of methionine.
population_specificity: Valeriana officinalis L. seedlings
effective_dosage: 400 μM methionine, 10 μM Cd, and phosphate concentrations of 900, 1200, and 1500 μM
study_duration: 4 days (Cd exposure) after 2 weeks of phosphate treatment

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update and re-evaluate existing data on Valerian's effectiveness for sleep problems and associated disorders, while investigating reasons for inconsistent outcomes in previous studies.
results_summary: Valerian showed potential as a safe and effective herb for improving sleep and reducing anxiety, with inconsistent outcomes possibly linked to variable extract quality. Combining it with appropriate herbal partners may optimize therapeutic benefits, and no severe adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Subjects aged 7 to 80 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of Valerian on cognitive disorders and electroencephalography (EEG) in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Valerian significantly improved cognitive scores in hemodialysis patients in both treatment periods, but no significant changes were observed in EEG results.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients (n=39)
effective_dosage: Valerian capsules taken 60 minutes before bedtime
study_duration: One month per treatment period, with a one-month wash-out between periods

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and tolerance of Valerian as an alternative treatment for insomnia in geriatric populations.
results_summary: The study suggests Valerian is considered an effective and suitable alternative for treating sleep disorders in aged people, though it emphasizes non-pharmacological approaches as first-line therapy.
population_specificity: Geriatric individuals with sleep disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether valerian root could reduce the impact, disability, and severity of tension-type headaches.
results_summary: The study found that valerian root significantly reduced the impact of headaches on daily living performance, disability, and severity compared to placebo, with all results showing statistical significance (p<0.001).
population_specificity: 88 participants with tension-type headache, average age 34.9 (±8.7) years.
effective_dosage: 530 mg of valerian root extraction (Sedamin® capsule), two capsules daily.

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of valerian in preventing neuropsychiatric adverse effects of efavirenz in HIV-positive patients.
results_summary: Valerian significantly improved sleep and anxiety compared to placebo in HIV-positive patients on efavirenz. Dizziness and nausea were common but not significantly different between groups.
population_specificity: HIV-positive patients receiving efavirenz-based ART.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of Valerian on the severity and frequency of hot flashes in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: Valerian significantly reduced the severity of hot flashes at one and two months compared to placebo, and the frequency of hot flashes was significantly reduced after two months. Health-care providers should consider Valerian effective for menopausal women with hot flashes.
population_specificity: 60 postmenopausal women aged 45-55 years in Hamadan, Iran.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish a screening method for psychoactive efficacy and test the effects of Valeriana officinalis crude root extracts on zebrafish larval behavior and neural activity.
results_summary: Valerian extract reversed PTZ-altered swimming behaviors in zebrafish larvae and strongly regulated neural activity-related genes, supporting its psychoactive efficacy. Higher doses of Valerian affected swimming independently of PTZ.
population_specificity: Zebrafish larvae

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of Valerian root extract on the intensity of PMS symptoms in female students.
results_summary: The study found that Valerian root extract significantly reduced emotional, behavioral, and physical PMS symptoms in the intervention group compared to placebo, with statistical significance (P < 0.001). No significant difference was observed in the control group.
population_specificity: 100 female students with PMS from Islamic Azad University, Tonekabon Branch, Iran.
effective_dosage: 2 pills daily (extract amount not specified) in the last seven days of the menstrual cycle.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a one-time 1600mg dose of valerian on subjective sedation, standardized field sobriety testing, and driving simulator performance.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in reaction time, sleepiness scales, or driving simulator performance between valerian and placebo. SFST failure rates were also similar between the two conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the application of 1D DOSY (1)H-NMR spectroscopy for characterizing quality and stability markers in Valerian and its combination with hops.
results_summary: The study identified diagnostic signals for quality markers in Valerian tinctures, such as valerenic acid and hydroxyvalerenic acid, using NMR techniques without requiring purification. It concluded that 1D DOSY (1)H-NMR could enhance quality assurance for complex herbal mixtures.
population_specificity: Commercial tinctures of Valerian (expired and non-expired) and its combination with hops.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the fumigant toxicity of valerian essential oil and its components against Japanese termites and assess their acetylcholinesterase inhibition activity.
results_summary: Valerian oil showed high fumigant toxicity against Japanese termites after 7 days of exposure, with certain constituents like hydrocinnamyl alcohol and trans-cinnamyl alcohol being major contributors. Only cis-ocimene exhibited strong acetylcholinesterase inhibition activity.
population_specificity: Japanese termites (Reticulitermes speratus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the inhibitory effects of Valerian on hepatocarcinogenesis in rats, focusing on oxidative DNA damage, cell proliferation, and apoptosis.
results_summary: Valerian significantly inhibited the formation of GST-P(+) foci, suppressed oxidative DNA damage, reduced cell proliferation, and induced apoptosis in liver foci, likely through GABA(A)R-mediated signaling.
population_specificity: Male F344 rats with diethylnitrosamine (DEN)-initiated hepatocarcinogenesis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of acupressure with 2.5% valerian oil on sleep quality and quantity in patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS).
results_summary: Patients receiving acupressure with valerian oil showed improved sleep quality and quantity compared to the control group, though the difference was not statistically significant compared to acupressure alone. The combination of acupressure and valerian oil had a greater impact on sleep improvement and reducing nighttime awakenings.
population_specificity: 90 patients with ACS in a coronary intensive care unit (CCU) in Iran.
effective_dosage: Two drops of 2.5% valerian oil applied during acupressure for 2 minutes per point, three nights in a row.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acetoxy valerenic acid interferes with the anxiolytic action of valerenic acid in Valerian extract.
results_summary: Acetoxy valerenic acid abolished the anxiolytic effect of valerenic acid, while the Valerian extract showed no affinity for benzodiazepine binding sites. No effect on body core temperature was observed.
population_specificity: Male CD-1 mice and male RjHan:WI rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Valerian on the severity and frequency of hot flashes in menopausal women.
results_summary: Valerian significantly reduced both the severity and frequency of hot flashes in menopausal women after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment, with statistically meaningful differences compared to the placebo group. No meaningful difference was observed in the placebo group.
population_specificity: Menopausal women experiencing hot flashes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether valerian/lemon balm could improve sleep patterns in menopausal women experiencing sleep disorders.
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in sleep disorders among the intervention group (valerian/lemon balm) compared to the placebo group, as measured by the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI). The results suggest valerian/lemon balm may help alleviate sleep disturbances during menopause.
population_specificity: 100 women aged 50-60 years with sleep disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a fixed combination of valerian root and lemon balm extracts could improve concentration, hyperactivity, and impulsiveness in children with these symptoms but not meeting ADHD criteria.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in symptoms of poor focus (75% to 14%), hyperactivity (61% to 13%), and impulsiveness (59% to 22%), with highly significant improvements in social behavior, sleep, and symptom burden. Only two mild transient adverse reactions were reported.
population_specificity: Primary school children (under 12 years) suffering from hyperactivity and concentration difficulties but not meeting ADHD criteria.
effective_dosage: 640 mg valerian root extract WS(®) 1014 and 320 mg lemon balm extract WS(®) 1303 daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of valerian for treating anxiety and sleep disorders by reviewing existing clinical studies.
results_summary: The evidence is insufficient to support valerian's efficacy for anxiety disorders, but it shows some effectiveness for mild to moderate insomnia, though limited by study quality. Valerian is well-tolerated with infrequent and benign side effects.
population_specificity: General population with anxiety or sleep disorders (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether valerian acupressure could improve sleep quality and duration in ICU patients.
results_summary: Valerian acupressure increased sleeping hours, reduced wake frequency, and lowered Stanford Sleepiness Scale grades. Heart rate variability data indicated a relaxation response post-intervention.
population_specificity: Adult ICU patients (41 in the experimental group, 44 in the control group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (acupressure intervention, not oral dosage).
study_duration: Single intervention between 7 pm and 10 pm on the second day.
